Class Soldier

  • java.lang.Object
    • Soldier
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Jedi, RebelSoldier, Sith, Stormtrooper

    public abstract class Soldier
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents basic Soldier functionality for Battlefront simulation DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE!

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Soldier(double health, double attack, double defense, java.lang.String identifier)
      Constructs a Soldier with a given health, attack, defense, and identfier.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Soldier

        public Soldier(double health,
               double attack,
               double defense,
               java.lang.String identifier)
        Constructs a Soldier with a given health, attack, defense, and identfier. NOTE: You cannot call this constructor directly as this class is abstract. You must extend this class and call this constructor via a super call in the subclass's constructor.
        Parameters:
        health - The health value this Soldier should begin with. Starting health must be at least 30.0 and up to 100.0
        attack - The attack value this Soldier should begin with. Attack is bounded by [0.0, 100.0];
        defense - The defense value this Soldier should begin with. Defense is bounded by [0.0, 100.0];
        identifier - The identifier of this Soldier.

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        public abstract double attack(Soldier target)
        Attacks a target soldier, using the hurt method to damage it. Concrete subclasses implement the logic for how much to hurt target Soldiers by.
        Parameters:
        target - The Soldier to attack.
        Returns:
        The amount of damage dealt to the target Soldier.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns:
        True if this Soldier is dead, false otherwise.

      • heal

        public void heal(double amount)
        Heals this Soldier by the given amount. An amount which would raise this Soldier's health above 100.0 results in health being set to 100.0.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to heal this Soldier by.

      • hurt

        public void hurt(double amount)
        Hurts this Solider by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to hurt this Soldier by.

      • changeAttack

        public void changeAttack(double delta)
        Changes this Soldier's attack value by the given amount. The resulting attack value will be bounded by [0.0, 100.0]. A delta which would lower attack below 0.0, results in attack being set to 0.0. A delta which would raise attack above 100.0, results in attack being set to 100.0.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount to change this Soldier's attack by.

      • changeDefense

        public void changeDefense(double delta)
        Changes this Soldier's defense value by the given amount. The resulting defense value will be bounded by [0.0, 100.0]. A delta which would lower defense below 0.0, results in defense being set to 0.0. A delta which would raise defense above 100.0, results in defense being set to 100.0.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount to change this Soldier's defense by.

      • getHealth

        public double getHealth()
        Returns:
        This Soldier's health.

      • getAttack

        public double getAttack()
        Returns:
        This Soldier's attack.

      • getDefense

        public double getDefense()
        Returns:
        This Soldier's defense.

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Returns:
        This Soldier's Identifier.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        This Solder's name with the format "Solder: [identifier]".
